name: Steve
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
What a great place! I arrived late and had to leave early, but still was able to get some work done. I rely heavily on wifi and The Shoe Inn had a great lightning quick connection! Exactly what I needed!
From the time you enter the front door, The Shoe Inn was immaculent! Everything you need is right there. So clean. The electric fireplace is a visual. Not sure if I was really tired or it was the comfort of the bed and pillows, but I don't think I moved the entire night. I didn't check in until 10:30pm, so the bar connected to the Inn was alive for a Saturday night. The noise... barely heard it and was no issue at all as I had work to do.
I highly recommend staying here if you have the opportunity whether it be one night or more. I'm definitely going to keep a lookout for it on future trips to the area.

review_text: I reserved at the last minute and it was quick and easy to pay and have access on short notice. The apt was cute, super clean, and I was able to park right outside the front door which gave comfort as I was transporting expensive items in my vehicle. The local grocery/general store was located right next door so I was able to grab a beer when I arrived and get coffee, a fountain drink, and a ham and cheese sandwich in the morning for the road which cost less than $5! Lovely space! The only issue I had was the keypad to get in. It was a bit fussy for me and took multiple tries to get in.

review_text:
I chose the Shoebox Inn despite it being out of my way, and I’m so glad I did! Honestly it ended up being one of my favorite Airbnb’s I’ve ever stayed in.
It was easy enough to find, had parking right in front, and felt safe enough even with me being a solo female traveler.
Once inside, it was clear that everything was new and sparkly clean. The washer and dryer was an added bonus. I would note that guests need to supply their own laundry detergent; I was glad I had some on hand!
I was able to hear the bar next door, but really only when using the bathroom. It was peaceful and quiet when it came time for me to go to sleep.
I’d definitely stay here again!

review_text: Great overnight stay in Teutopolis. Easy to find, very cute studio type unit. Very well appointed, perfect accommodations for a short or long stay. While there is a train crossing about a 1/4 mile away, noise was not an issue. I heard only two trains go through the area while I was there and I don't believe either blew its horn (besides, I like the sound of trains passing...). The owners are very congenial and helpful and respond to messages immediately. They offered suggestions on nearby restaurants and best ways to venture about the area. Also, great beer specials and friendly people at the gaming bar next door. As Arnold once said, "I'll be back".

There was a little bit of sound from the bar next door but not enough to disrupt our sleep. Don’t let the location deter you from staying here. Great space that is well-decorated and perfectly-stocked!
The only downside was the local coffee shops & restaurants are closed on Sunday morning but there are plenty of available places in the neighboring town (Effingham). We had a great breakfast at Niemerg’s which is a very popular local restaurant.

review_text:
Cute and clean! Exactly as described! Got a late start on my drive so couldn’t make it to my original destination, and I am so glad! Found the Shoebox Inn it was the perfect stay. Easy to access. I parked right in front, and could take my suitcase in without having to deal with steps.
As in the host description, the space is attached to the pub. I could hear some of the chatter and music through the wall but it wasn’t particularly loud and didn’t keep me awake. And if I’d needed them, there was a white noise machine and ear plugs.
Comfortable bed.
The window faces the street and sidewalk and the blackout curtains allowed for complete privacy.
Look forward to coming back through this way again and having a little more time so I can enjoy the fireplace and go to the pub and game room with nice wooden shoe motif.
Janice and John were very responsive, helpful, and polite!

review_text:
LOVED the ShoeInn!! We were visiting family in Teutopolis, so the location was perfect!! Super clean, just like the pics. Whoever designed, did a great job. I've stayed in hotels that were not nearly as nice, plus what a steal!!
The hosts-and friends had warned that there might be a noise issue due to a gaming place literally next door (shares walls). However, it was only talking we ever heard, kind of like when your roommate is talking too loud in their room. All we did was shut the bathroom door & the vestibule door-the only places you could actually hear it-and we were fine! We had a speaker to listen to just in case, and the host provides earplugs (didn't use) & a white noise machine (accidentally turned it on then couldn't figure out where the fan was coming from!).
Super clean & cozy-loved the fireplace!! Will definitely stay again!
Martha & Rich

review_text: I accidentally picked the perfect location in relationship to why I was in T-town. I was able to walk to my destination. The Shoe Inn was clean, comfortable, and decorated for the holidays. If I could rate it higher than 5 stars, I would! I'll be back next year! Maybe stay 2 nights so I can check out to attached Bar. Appreciate the honesty about the noise potential from the bar, it was only barely noticeable and did not prevent me from getting a great night's sleep in that big bed. Thank-you Janice and John!

name: Ryan & Adrienne
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
We’ve stayed at quite a few properties, and this was hands down the best one. Clearly Janice & John know what they’re doing and you can tell a lot of time, energy, sweat and creative thinking went into this hidden gem.
Every single detail is accounted for and the well laid out instructions are second to none.
The space is modern, well designed, well built, comfy, safe and so clean you could eat off the floor. The holiday decor was the cherry on top.
Being connected to an elegant bar & a Saturday night, we wondered how it would play out. Never heard a thing other than some very faint music while in the shower, and who doesn’t like tunes in the shower ? We’re convinced the walls have been soundproofed.
We will stay nowhere else when passing through in the future if it’s available. Cool little town and an amazing place. We’d give it 10 stars if it were possible.

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Unfortunately I was cancelled last minute so I’m not sure why I’m being asked to review but 1 star was all I could muster as this was a rather significant inconvenience. I’m a post Covid PTSD Nurse survivor and my therapy dog is retiring and my new pup in training is taking his place. This shouldn’t of been reason to cancel and I didn’t have time or energy to fix it as I was traveling post holidays on an unexpected timeline. I ended up staying in an over priced scary motel in the middle of the Midwest. I save lives, and I’m struggling to save my own health in a broken and delayed system. Shame on you for not allowing my fur children who are literally saving my life helping me fight night terrors by placing my in a situation out of my comfort zone. Do better, or stop using this plat form!

Stayed one night
review_text: We stayed only one night on our way through on a road trip. I did not know the area, just chose it based on the distance we were wanting to travel that day. I was a bit nervous because I got an AMAZING rate (too good to be true) so I thought the area might not be good. WOW! We were so impressed! The area was perfect just off the Hwy with Walmart, gas stations, many restaurants both sit down and quick serve, shops, liquor store all within walking distance! The lobby was very clean and modern looking. The hostess was at the desk and greeted us immediately. Check in took 5 min at most and she told us we could use the pool and breakfast was included even though we booked through AirB&B (some places don’t allow this). The pool was super warm and clean. Very quiet even though we were near an elevator. Room was beautiful, clean, looked like the pictures and was huge. A/C worked great and Internet was fast! Check out was easy just dropped the key cards at the desk. definitely worth $.

STAINS ON THE PADS AND MATTRESSES IT WAS THE DEATH NAIL IN THE COFFIN FOR HER TEEN BIRTHDAY WEEKEND. WHEN I LOOKED AT REVIEWS THERE WERE MANY OF THE SAME INCIDENTS HAPPENING TO LOTS OF GUESTS AND THE RESPONSES FROM THE HOTEL WERE TO STATE OVER AND OVEHEY WERE ISOLATED INCIDENTS WHICH IS RIDICULOUS CONSIDERING the volume of complaints. In all these cases, there is not any resulted in a refund of any kind. AIR BNB WAS THE ONLY WAY ID END UP THERE.(LAQUINTA). I thought airbnb "weeded out the weakness". 1 was there from 7pm check in to 7 pm the next day.

Stayed one night
review_text: How lucky for us that we stopped for an overnight stay in Effingham, Illinois, during our cross-country drive from Los Angeles to New York. Determined to get a small town experience, we booked Michael and Teagan's loft apartment in a 100-year-old converted bank on this charming town's main street. The apartment could easily be in Manhattan, with exposed brick, hardwood floors, and oversized windows. It was the perfect space to unwind, with a comfortable kitchen, living room and separate bedroom and bath. Why would anyone stay at a boring chain hotel on the interstate when this kind of memorable accommodation is just a few miles away? We absolutely LOVED Effingham and our 24 hours there was a true highlight of our trip.

review_text:
The loft is an amazing space. No negatives about inside of the unit or the location.
Cons:
Sound —You share a wall with another loft. Unlucky, but there was a bridal party in it and I could hear over a dozen excited women squealing and stomping around for hours at a time. You can hear even normal level conversations from the other unit .
Host — after the bridal party finally left I took a nap. I woke to some man standing in the middle of the apartment talking. One of Startled, I jumped out of bed confused thinking someone had broken In. The host. This is unacceptable and warrants 0 stars. He didn’t message first or call, etc . He said he wanted to check the water since another part of the building had an issue. But he took my word for it not being an issue and didnt even check it . Again, clearly could’ve and should’ve messaged first. Especially coming from a host that needs you to tell them you’ve checked in and sends you an optional cleaning to do list for your final night .

review_text: Honestly this was worlds beyond what I thought it was going to be. The pictures do not do justice to how amazing this loft is and how unbelievable the area is! Squeaky clean and modern in every inch of the loft. So much to do just steps from the loft like fine dining, great bars, awesome shopping (I bought a classic Babe Ruth framed photo from the 1920’s and my wife bought all kinds of clothes!) The nook in the loft is amazing! The bed is completely comfortable. Shower head was uniquely designed and felt great! Bathroom pristine. Kitchen pristine. TV was HUGE! Parking was right behind the building and easy to navigate and we met so many unbelievably charming and nice people throughout the entire downtown area . This was the best weekend getaway my wife and I have ever taken and we will be coming back again and again in the future. Thank you Michael and Ann! Keep rocking it out!!!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: We needed a place to unwind and get good rest on our way from Florida to Wisconsin. We stayed here on drive day 2 of 3, and were exhausted when we got to Effingham. The place was easy to find, instructions were clear and I was able to get into the lock box and then the loft in just a few minutes. There are a lot of stairs to walk up when you first come in, and no elevator, so keep that in mind if you don’t do well with stairs or dont like stairs. The loft space is incredible! Wide-open concept and ceilings that had to be about 15 feet high or more. They had the place spotless clean like a model loft getting ready to be photographed for a magazine. They had a free bottle of wine waiting for me, which was much needed on this trip. We stayed up a few hours after arrival, playing shuffleboard, which is one of my favorite things to play. The bed was really comfortable, the shower was super cool, the bathroom clean, and it was just amazing staying there. The hosts are super amazing too!

The hosts are very responsive and proactive!
We could occasionally hear the neighbors in the next door unit, which was a first for us (we chalked it up to holiday excitement), but everyone respected the quiet time hours and all was well!

Stayed one night
review_text: This rental is everything it says it is, clean, nicely appointed, in a great area. However, we had an issue with noisy neighbors. With the renovation of the space, there is a wall that is not original brick and may be just a drywall wall between two units allowing noise to transfer very easily. The people next door were having a gathering and were very loud, so much so that we could not sleep. It was as if they were sitting in our living area. I called the host at midnight and asked her to intervein. She got ahold of the people next door, and everything was quiet by 12:30. Hopefully it was a one time issue, however, we only got 5 1/2 hours of sleep and had to drive 7 hours the next morning. If it were not for the noise issue, I would have rated it a 5.

review_text: My parents, boyfriend, and our pup all stayed here over the weekend for a wedding in Shelbyville. This was my parents first AirBnB experience and they were absolutely blown away. The building is an old bank that is newly (beautifully) renovated, very clean, and the hosts have obviously tried to think of everything you need to have a comfortable stay. We weren't sure what to expect, but the town of Effingham is so unexpectedly quaint, with friendly locals, a farmer's market on Saturday mornings, and a beautiful town museum. Very walkable and doggy-friendly! Highly recommend staying here for both the AirBnB and to experience all that Effingham has to offer. Wouldn't mind heading back for relaxing mini vacation! We were sad to leave! Thank you to the hosts for a great weekend.

The local town was cute too - we ordered from Joe's Pizza then picked up breakfast at Daylight Donuts and Fox Holler, all locales that came recommended in the well-done visitors guide that Katy provided. We are already planning a trip back to Effingham for a visit rather than just a stopover and would love to stay in Katy's place again.

review_text: Love this Airbnb! It was super cute. I love the old school exposed brick, meeting up with a very modern style! It is right in the middle of downtown, close to food, bars, and a grocery store. The little area is super cute, and super dog friendly. Learned how to play a few of the games there, and learned I am pretty great at shuffleboard lol. The book nook is adorable, there's plenty of books to keep you busy for a weekend in, and I love how stocked it is. Last Airbnb we went to, gave us two towels for a week stay and almost no utensils. This one was well stocked on everything, including pots, pans, plates, cups etc. Even had shampoo and conditioner etc there for use. Bed and couch is super soft. I love it. Recommend Fox Holler coffee. We are already planning to come back here early fall or next year in the spring.

The entire loft is cleaned extremely well, and both beds, the regular bed and the couch pull out, are super comfortable with no shortage of pillows.
A few personal favorite features:
1. Rain shower head!
2. Sit & Stand adjustable desk
3. Window reading nook
4. Shuffle board setup
5. A few hidden surprises ;)

review_text: MUST STAY! This loft space is absolutely stunning. The exposed brick, high ceilings, lighting fixtures, everything is just beautiful. You can see how much work went into the remodel. There were also so many personal touches that really showcase how kind the humans running it are. We walked in to find complimentary wine, popcorn, coffee, and water bottles, as well as suggestions for all of their favorite local spots (some of which are in walking distance). There were plenty of extra blankets, towels, toiletries, and more. The bed was also one of the comfiest I have ever slept on, and even the pillows were really nice. Parking and entry were both painless. I was sad to leave and I honestly can't wait to stay again in the future!

Michael and Katy’s place in downtown Effingham was wonderful. Super clean and exactly what you’d expect from the photos.
Very easy to walk to restaurants (Our favorite was Frugal Pond Pub. Get the honey quesadilla and say hi to Leroy!) and other Effingham establishments.
It truly is an effing wonderful home base for exploring Central Illinois (visit Mattoon for the Bagelfest! It’s BYOB though - bring your own bagel.).
Michael and Katy were super responsive and flexible to our itinerary. It made check-in/check-out a breeze. Major gratitude, y’all!

review_text: This may possibly be one of the best Air B and Bs my husband has ever stayed at. The décor, the cleanliness, the responsiveness of the hosts, the location - everything about it is a 10. We come to Effingham a couple of times a year to visit my husband's family and we will only stay here going forward. We bring our two little Morkies and it is so much more room for them here than in a hotel room. The pictures don't do it justice, it is a huge space with lots of room and high ceilings. The parking is a breeze. The steps to load and unload the luggage are a little strenuous, but nothing to stop us from staying again. It is walking distance to many bars and restaurants. They have a shuffleboard game in the living room. There was plenty of anything you needed within the loft - toilet paper, dish detergent, laundry detergent, etc. I cannot say enough great things about this place!

review_text: A Beautiful open modern Apartment nestled in the heart of Effingham, IL. With courteous and professional host, you will have everything taken care of before you step into the door. This was our first air b&b experience and loved the ease of "checking in" at our own convenience with no need to wait on a host or let them know our schedule like a bed and breakfast. It was very nice to be able to throw in some laundry before we went to bed and have coffee at our convenience in the morning. The decor is perfect for the space. Michael and Katie made sure we had ample of bedding needed with the double mattress height air up mattresses. The appliances are all up to date if you want to warm up any food and the basic but classy plateware will cover all your needs. If we need to stay in town again, this will be our first choice.

We had a wonderful stay here. The pictures are accurate and its a beautiful loft. It made us feel like we are in a sleek modern / urban New York city apartment with all the exposed brick and piping. Very cool. The loft is literally right down town and there are multiple small boutiques, restaurants, and grocery store all within a minutes walk.
Michael was very accommodating and responsive to text messages. We even brought our 3 month old and they set up a pack n play for her to sleep in at night. This really helped us keep down the amount of stuff we had to bring for her so it was a huge help.
The only issue you may run into (which wasn't a problem for us) is that there are a lot of stairs to get up to the loft. So if you struggle climbing stairs then you may have a little bit of a hard time getting up and down them.
Thanks again to you both and we will definitely be back. 5 out of 5 stars overall.

review_text: I have stayed at many vacation rental houses with family and friends over the years, and this was one of the better stocked places and it easily accommodated the 8 adults in my group. Whether we were all in the living room, at the dining room table, or on the patio, there was seating for everyone. All of the beds and pillows were comfortable and of good quality. The BBQ grill was clean and an extra propane tank was ready as a backup. We cooked all of our meals at the house and found all the cookware and table settings we needed. We rented a pontoon boat from Rusty Reel Marina, which is on the other side of the lake, and we enjoyed sightseeing and fishing around the lake. Thanks for the nice accommodations!

name: Matlyn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: I stayed here for 3 months and it was AMAZING! It had everything I could think or needed in the kitchen. Great washer and dryer and very nice bathroom. The kitchen and amenities are all modern with stainless steal appliances, new washer/dryer, great shower, etc. When I arrived it was very clean. It is very cute from the inside and out. I never had any problems with the Wi-Fi during my stay and it was fast. I actually had no problems while I was there! The backyard has cute landscaping. It is located behind a nice and safe subdivision. I took walks throughout the week around the subdivision. It is a quite area and still located 10-15 minutes from chain restaurants and stores. Located 1 minute down the road is a gas station/mini mart for all the last minute things you would need as well as a few local bars with good bar food! The hosts are quick to respond. For people who are staying for a short-time or have a quick turn around the breakfast set up is nice with teas, coffees, Keurig, to-go cups, oatmeal. etc. The two televisions were great lots of options on what to watch as well as easy hook up to your netflix, hulu, etc. Comfortable mattress and pillows! I felt very comfortable there and was able to get a good nights sleep on the first few nights of being in a new and unfamiliar place which is very important!

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2020
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Incredible stay! Very large one bed room space for my wife and I. Wonderfully decorated, spotless clean, fresh sheets, and FINALLY a comfortable bed! That is more than enough, however that is not all you get. For the price if less than a Holiday Inn or similar stay, you get an entire kitchen fully stocked with a fridge stove microwave dishes and utensils, a spacious bathroom with a great shower, your own washer dryer, and an entire living room complete with a big screen tv. Once you wake up I suggest making yourself a complementary cup of coffee and sitting out on the back porch and listening to the church bell tower ring out the time (loud enough to hear outside but not inside). Mary and Ryan were incredible hosts, we got into the house pretty late and they accommodated us with ease. Keyless entry to the home made check in and out quick and painless. If you’re going to be in the area, stop looking for a place to stay, you just found it.

Side comment for anyone driving to the place at night, looks like the general neighborhood is under construction and expanding. Some map systems might not take you straight to the location, but if you continue East on State street you should see a mailbox with "112" on the other side of the street opposing the residence. Thanks Mary and Ryan!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
There was so much we enjoyed and appreciated about this house! It was clean, and has a modern, classy style and decor with quality appliances, cabinetry, countertops, etc... It was very spacious for our large family, and is in a nice area for family walks. It was interesting to look at the old, collectible items in some of the closets, like older books, classic board games, antique typewriter and more. The bedding was very comfortable, the master shower was great, and the kitchen well stocked.
The upstairs bedrooms were a bit warm, maybe it’s just this time of year, but if anyone in your group has issues/health issues where it might be a problem for them, then you might want to plan to have them sleep downstairs. It did cool down overnight though. Jerry was very accommodating to allow us an early check in. Overall, a great stay for our family of nine!

review_text:
We have stayed at many Airbnb’s because it is so much more convenient with young kids than a hotel. This was by far the nicest home we have stayed in. It was immaculately clean and the care and finishing touches put into the home’s design and amenities were so impressive our parents walked around remarking on them the entire time, and even joked about taking photos for reference for their own home!
Jerry’s communication was great, and he was very kind in working with us when we requested a later checkout.
We would absolutely stay again and would highly recommend! Beautiful home, and fantastic host. Thank you!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
It is a beautifully, decorated home that is also very comfortable. The kitchen includes a multitude of dish-ware options and large, modern appliances including the fridge and dishwasher. The handcrafted cabinetry and open concept made the kitchen and dining area one of our favorite places to gather.
Having access to the grill and fire pit let us enjoy the outdoors. We had lots of space inside and out to visit with our relatives.
The close proximity to Effingham made getting groceries and eating out quick and easy. We recommend the Gabby Goat.
Jerry and Fran were fantastic hosts. They answered our questions before arriving and during the visit promptly. This is a great place to stay.

name: Chelsea

,
·
January 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Jerry’s place went above and beyond expectations! My best friend and our nieces desperately wanted a girls weekend, and this place did not disappoint!! Jerry was very communicative, kind, and helpful! We had one of the absolute best times, and it couldn’t have been more perfect. It was absolutely the comforts of home without actually being home. The bathroom was incredible, the kitchen was a dream, and all of the updates were such a great touch! It was also so kid friendly! We had a little tornado with us, and it was set up with little ones in mind too. When we arrived we had a very minor issue with one of the lights. It was absolutely no big deal, but he went above and beyond to accommodate what he felt was an inconvenience to us. The sleeping accommodations were absolutely fantastic. We are already planning our next girls weekend and a couples weekend for later this year! Every little detail you could think of was taken care of. You will fall in love with Jerry’s just like we did!

Awesome views from the apartment, overlooking the heart of the downtown area, which was quaint and scenic. As soon as you walk out of the apartment, there’s a great restaurant to eat at that’s also kid friendly just a few steps away. The hosts outlined every aspect of the stay perfectly, also laying out recommendations of where to eat and places to go. I could go on and on about this place, but it’d be too long of a review for someone to probably want to read. To sum it up, don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to stay at this amazing place. My 6 year old and I did not want to leave. We will definitely be booking this place in the future again!

review_text: This place is the bomb. If you are anywhere near Effingham, don’t hesitate to book your stay here. Everything was clean and high quality. The games were great. It was fun to be in a loft, looking down on the town. I was sad that the brewery has closed down, but there were plenty of other options. The farmer’s market was great. Historic downtown was cool. The stairs up to the loft entrance are not easy with suitcases, so be aware of that. It wasn’t a problem for us, but it could be for others. Overall, this place was relaxing and quiet for my family but it would also be a fantastic meeting place for family reunions, etc. My family really enjoyed our stay. Thank you!

Stayed about a week
review_text: If you want or need to visit folks in central/southern Illinois, or are traveling through - this place is perfect. I rented two units to create the perfect thanksgiving/early xmas gathering, and I truly could not have asked for more. Big, bright, beautiful spaces. Modern decor, great amenities (shuffleboard, games, washer/dryer) - all the things I needed to entertain my four kids, two grandkids, and my daughters partners - who all live in Illinois while I live in California. The exposed brick, all the wood, big tvs, and comfy furniture - yes, please. The giant kitchen islands with stools - perfect for where every family gathers - but completely open to the living area. Restaurants of every flavor in every direction, arcade, wine store, shops and boutiques... I could not have asked for more. We'll be back if they'll have us - for sure. Having stayed in amazing airrbnbs all over the country, it ranks among the best. Not a bad spot for a staycation or remote working need as well.

review_text: This place is incredible. Everything about this Airbnb experience was top notch and without a hitch. It is the best-equipped place I’ve ever stayed in and no doubt the most comfortable. It’s spacious, impeccably clean and the basket of keurigs, the bottled water and the offer of a bottle of wine makes you feel right at home. The beds are comfy, each room has tons of space and fun games like Asteroids are the icing on this cake. Katy and Michael are fantastic to work with and any time I had a question about they responded in seconds. I cannot think of one thing that needs to be better. Oh and the downtown location cannot be beat! Within walking distance to bars, restaurants and a grocery store. They even have white noise machines even though I didn’t need it to sleep. I usually do! Thanks for the best experience.

review_text:
We were fortunate to stay at Katy’s loft in downtown Effinburg.
This is a beautiful loft. The view from the living room is so beautiful and even though it is downtown on a busy street, it was very quiet.
This is a 3 bedroom loft. Each bedroom was very comfortable with high end linens. Everyone enjoyed a very restful sleep. The decor and art in the loft is beautiful. We loved looking at all the details.
Two sparkling clean bathrooms with all the amenities you would need. Fluffy towels and good water pressure.
All of the appliances in the kitchen are in great working condition. I was able to cook and because of the layout - I could enjoy my family while cooking.
I highly recommend this property. You can walk to all the local restaurants and bars. Downtown is very nice and you feel safe walking.
The hosts were available and very good communicators. Answered all questions promptly and gave great recommendations for local fare.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
The good: The cabin is about what you would expect from the pictures. Easily identifiable from the outside. There is a nice little path, right down to the lakeside and the dock. Checking in was as simple as entering the door code. Lots of information available, left by the hostess. Checkout instructions, as far as what their expectations were, were made pretty clear. The place was immaculately clean
The not so good: The area is a little crowded. The properties on either side are very close, one even sharing a driveway. Plus there are loads of campers right across the road. So a private, secluded cabin in the woods, it is not. The driveway is narrow, and at an odd angle, that makes it nearly impossible to turn and back up in a long pickup. It can be done, but it’s a challenge.
The outstanding: Responsiveness. Between Kristen and her co-host, Marietta, they were right on top of any question I had for them. Responses were timely and they were very accommodating and easy to work with.

review_text: Modern update of an original lake property. For the cost of a local hotel room, we got the whole house! This lake property is located on a campground with many year round campers but at this time of the year, we didn't see anyone else around so it was very quiet! It has a great location in that it is "a hop, skip and a jump" from the public playground, beach, and pavilions. There was also new pickleball courts, bocce ball, disk golf, as well as golf courts there! Pinky's is on the next road too! Kristen let us look at the adjacent property she has for a possible future rental. Both were clean, modern interior, and had everything you might need! Things I appreciated: selection of pillows, comfy bed, wonderful shower head with great pressure, Roku TV and even had some DVDs to watch, a fan(I forgot mine and love a bit a air flow when I sleep), shampoo and conditioner in the shower to use, and extra blankets in living room to snuggle up on the couch with. Close to everything in town also

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Our family of four and dog had the absolute best time at Kristen’s cabin. She shared listings for local golf, restaurants and a boat rental. She even allowed me to borrow a crockpot. It was spotless upon our arrival so we were able to drop off our stuff and get outdoors to fish and kayak immediately. Our only full day was a little rainy but we made the most of it by playing games and watching movies using the streaming services available. Our kids, 10 & 12, never complained once about being bored and we didn’t even allow them to play on their electronics. Also, I go back to teaching in a couple weeks and being away from home in such a peaceful place helped me to focus on lesson planning. Our time at the cabin was invaluable and we hope to visit again!

The cabin was super clean and stocked with everything you could imagine. It was peaceful and not too far off the beaten path. I could NOT have asked for anything more. Although my dad struggled with the TV… lol but we made due. Ha!
Thank you!!!

review_text:
We have been to Lake Sarah 5 or 6 times since 2020 and we stayed at Kristen's place the last 2 or 3 times. The cabin is super clean and has all of the little touches to make it a great place. Everything is very well thought out and she is a GREAT host.
It has a covered parking area and a covered dock which is wonderful if there is rain during your stay.
The fishing is excellent and there are a couple nice golf courses very close as well. Our preference is the Fore-Way 9-hole course but we have also played Cardinal Golf Course and Meadowview Golf Course in Mattoon
We plan to be back for many years to come.
Thank you Kristen!

review_text: We had a great time here. All the details of the place are well thought out and it was easy to get in and out. The location is great in the woods and next to the lake. They even have kayaks to take out on the lake. The cabin is next to a campground but it was still quiet. It’s fast to get into town and there are walking/biking trails nearby. Plus the heating/cooling/cooking systems were efficient electric ones, so no nasty methane (natural gas) fumes. It was a great stay!
